headline: Apple Spice Cake
description: Very moist spicy sweet cake with chunks of tender apples and raisins.
name: Apple Spice Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 10 inch tube pan. Cover raisins with warm water, let soak for 10 minutes and then drain. Whisk together flour, spices, and salt. Set aside.

Cream together butter or margarine and sugar. Mix in eggs and vanilla. Stir together soda and 1 tablespoon warm water, and mix into the sugar mixture. Stir in flour mixture, apples, and strained raisins until well blended. Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for approximately 1 hour, or until a tester comes out clean. Cool in pan. Once cool, shake pan to loosen cake. Turn onto plate, and dust with confectioners' sugar.

review.reviewBody: This cake is so good my husband asked me to make it again. I would add a touch more of the spices and a little more raisins to replace walnuts. I am going to make this today again. Its been a couple weeks now I am ready for another delicious moist cake oh I also prefer to drizzle homemade caramel glaze on it
Other than adding walnuts, made this exactly as called for. This cake is DA BOMB! Moist, dense and the perfect blend of spices. Absolutely delicious!

I think this is the best cake I've ever made. I adjusted it to be both gluten-free and dairy -free by substituting Red Mill 1 to 1 gluten- free flour and Crisco butter-flavored shortening. I melted some tub frosting and poured it on for icing and some caramel and walnuts.
My family loved it! I used 3 granny smith apples. Changes I made: doubled all spices, 1/2 cup each of the following (unsweetened apple sauce, butter, white sugar), 1 cup dark brown sugar.
We loved this recipe! We followed as described and made little Bundt cakes and then drizzled caramel over the top and oh my goodness… yum!
Made this for a special brunch. Everyone loved it.
Beyond delicious. My husband ate it everyday for breakfast with his coffee. I wouldn’t change a thing. I wanted to take a picture but it went to fast.

This was spectacular. I made just a few changes. I didn’t finely dice the apple, but used about 1” chunks and added one extra small apple, used cinnamon, cardamom, and nutmeg as the spices, and omitted the raisins. I also made a glaze by reducing down some apple cider (1 cup cider, reduced to 1/4 c. syrup) which I mixed with confectioners sugar and a pinch of salt. This was delicious!
Delicious!!! This cake is so yummy, moist and full fall spice flavor! I didn’t change a thing and it turned about amazing.
Delicious! I omitted the raisins and cooked this in two nine inch cake rounds because I didn't have a bundt pan. They came out very moist and amazing!
Absolutely Delicious!!!

This is a fantastic cake as written and I have rated it as such but I feel like a few minor tweaks make it even better! I have made it as written, read a ton of reviews and personally prefer it with these adjustments:
Very Good! I thought I had raisins but didn't so put in dried cranberries. very tasty. My dinner guest loved it and her comment the next day was yummm. Not to spicey, may add a little more next time.

did the recipe in half into a 8" square. 
So very moist - I'll be making this again!!!
Left out the raisins and added a bit more apple. My teenage son loved it.
My husband absolutely loved this. I used a recipe for a confectioners icing and it worked perfect with it.

I had a Spice box cake mix. The box called for 1/3 of a cup of vegetable oil, 3 eggs and a cup of water. Because I was adding a can of apple pie filling to the mix, I did not add as the box stated. Instead I reduced the water to 1/2 cup, reduced the eggs to only 2 and I kept the vegetable oil at 1/3 of a cup. I also added the allspice, nutmeg and cinnamon (even though it was a spice box mix). It turned out moist and delicious. I had to cook it about 10 minutes longer and I thought it was "heavy" but it was done and tasted delicious.
Made this for a potluck. Everyone loved it. Was moist and tasty. Followed the recipe however did decrease sugar to 1.5 cups. Will switch to half brown sugar next time and add more cinnamon.
Absolutely wonderful. I shredded 2 Granny Smith and a gala. That made it moist and flavorful. Will make again for sure. It was a hit at the party I took it to.
I did not add the raisins but everyone still loves it! It was my first time making an Apple spice cake but it was a hit. I’ll definitely be making this again!
Very very good.
I added 1/2 cup Brown sugar and only 1 cup of white sugar. I also measured the chopped apples. I used 2 1/2 cups .
Omitted raisins and used gluten free flour (Pamela’s artisan blend). SO good! Moist inside and a thin crisp outside in my bundt pan.
I made a half recipe but kept the spice amounts of the full....Very tasty
Absolutely delicious! Wouldn't change a thing. May be my new favorite fall dessert.

Simply fantastic. I added fresh Black Cherries; was even better. Made it twice. First time, had enough batter to make half in an Instant Pot (Bundt) and the other half in the oven (spring form). They came out almost identical: both incredibly moist and delicious. Not too sweet, and yet did NOT require icing or even powdered sugar (optional, in other words). HIGHLY recommended.
Disappointed. It was very crusty on top but the cake itself was too moist. I won’t make it again. My brother liked it. The taste was good.

Just made this cake and could hardly wait for it to cool down.
I can't wait to share this with my friends. I can't say enough good things about this cake! Ummmmmmm! Kinda sums it up. I soaked the raisins in the water with a little Rum added. Other than that, I made this recipe exactly as written. I'd like to give it 10 stars!

Excellent recipe as written. The only additions I made were 1/4 cup each of coconut and chopped walnuts. Such a moist, delicious cake! A real hit with the family.
I also made an easy caramel sauce that knocked it out of the park: 1 cup butter, 1 cup brown sugar, 1-2 T milk, dash of salt, and dash of vanilla. Combine and cook, stirring, until smooth. Use warm.
Recipe says tube pan. Picture shows Bundt pan
I will definitely make this again! It was easy and turned out beautifully. Everyone here loved it. The only thing that I might change is to add more spices.

Amazingly wonderful!!! I used three diced Granny Smith apples, 1 cup of white sugar, 1/2 cup of brown, soaked the golden raisins in rum and added pecans. Baked in a bundt pan only took 50 minutes. The aroma was so inviting, I couldn't wait for it to cool. I sprinkled powdered sugar on the top. So yummy!!!!

This cake is our new favorite fall cake! I modified the recipe a little bit though... I couldn't find my "regular" measuring spoons; the ones that I had were table spoons only...! I didn't have allspice so I added, instead, 1/2tbs ground cloves and 1/2tbs of fresh grated ginger. As for the cinnamon, I grated it from a stick instead of the powder (that i don't like anyway). To be on the safe side, I also added 1/2tbs of baking powder. 
Here's how I modified it so it would be a touch fluffier:
1cup all purpose flour and 1 cup of cake flour. A little less than 1/2tbs fresh grated nutmeg (way better flavor than the already ground one) and I was out of white sugar so I only had 1/2cup of white sugar and 1 1/2cup of brown sugar. I separated the egg whites from the yolks, and added 1/2tsp cream of tartar to the whites and brought the whites to stiff peaks, set aside. Oh, also, I replace the cup of oil by a cup of homemade apple sauce. I added the fresh ginger to the mixture of apple sauce and sugar. Then followed the recipe and the last thing that I did was to fold the whites to the batter. My cake fluffed so much, it is nice and thick and the house smell so good. Looking forward to have it tonight with our Thanksgiving dinner! Oh, I forgot, I also added 1/4cup of walnut pieces. Voilà! Thank you!!!
Very sweet! If I make it again I will cut back on the sugar.
Moist and delicious. We had it for brunch with a cup of coffee. Used tart apples from our tree.
Didn’t alter anything and turned our perfect!!! Great recipe, thank you!
Smelled wonderful cooking. Filled the Bundt pan. So delicious.

Love it. I’ve made this cake on more than one occasion using King Arthur gluten-free flour blend. Some gf-adapted recipes work better than others in terms of texture, which can be gritty. This is very good, probably because the cake is so moist. I bump up the spices by at least half to suit our taste.

Tried a different cake prior to this which only used clove and cinnamon and the flavor was missing. This recipe had a great combination of spices and was very well balanced. I used 4 different types of apples to provide some balance of sweet and sour and this cake turned out fabulous. Moist and flavorful, not sure what else I could ask from it. Awesome share!

It was very tasty. Following the directions as written lead to a type of bread pudding or may pass as a cobbler. I used 3 large apples, maybe I should use medium? We still enjoyed the flavors and texture, really hoping for more of a spice cake.
We absolutely will bake it again, still searching for the perfect apple raisin spice cake that excites our pallet.

It is an amazing spice cake. I will cut back on the sugar next time as others commented. I also grated the apples because I didn’t want chunks. It makes it very moist. Next time I will only grate 2 apples instead of 3. Thank goodness I poured off the extra water from the apples or it would’ve been wet instead of moist. Will definitely make it again but will use loaf pans and add nuts. Amazing cake!!
Only okay. Greasy and kinda spicy. Apples didn't stand out. Too much nutmeg for my taste.

Very good recipe. I did do a few changes for health reasons. I swapped out the white sugar and white flour for brown sugar and whole wheat flour. It came out incredibly well. Fluffy and light. I would add a bit more spice the next time but every one enjoyed it and helped themselves until there was no more. You know if that happens then it is a good recipe. Thumbs up!
YUM!

Delicious. Best apple cake recipe I've used. Took advice and used less sugar (1 1/2C) using 1/2 white and 1/2 brown sugar. Added a little more cinnamon. Also 1/2 C butter, 1/2C applesauce. Husband loved it. This is a keeper.
It is so good! I followed the instructions without changing anything. Yum I can't stop eating it.

followed others comments (less sugar, in total - also subbed some brown sugar ill of white, marinate raisins in 43 liqueur for a bit, upped the spices, cut back o butter - added in apple sauce shredded apples in food proc.)....Also I added on a traditional cream cheese frosting. I baked in a 9 x 13 for 40 -ish minutes also. I found the cake VERY dense. in fact it is Super heavy in the pan. I refrigerated overnight and the flavor is decent but this was too dense for me. I almost wish i had used cake flour and more leavening agent... the search continues. (the hubs said it was ok but he didn't rave)
Will definitely make it again. This time, though, i'll skip the raisins. They don't add anything. I dusted mine with powdered sugar instead of using the honey glaze.
We love this cake ... with 4 apple trees I like trying different recipes ... this one is a keeper.

Cake is very good.Like many others I played with the recipe a bit.Half brown,half white sugar .One half cup butter ,one half cup homemade applesauce.Diced Granny Smith apples.Since in my house cake, must be frosted.I made it in a 13 by 9 pan and made cream cheese icing.

I doubled the amount of apples (three green and three red)substituted cranberries for raisins. I used half brown sugar and half white sugar. I am sure the basic recipe is great without my changes but I just couldn't resist my urge to experiment. By the way, I am in the process of baking this cake again today.

Very moist cake that keeps well. I baked it for Christmas this year, but I didn't have raisins, so I used craisins (cranberries) instead. It turned out really well. I also added my own buttercream frosting instead of the powdered sugar sprinkle. I'll definitely make this one again! ??

Added one cup of nuts, instead of raisins. Also decreased the sugar, and used brown and white. Also added a little bit of grated ginger to the mix. Also put some of the spices on the nuts with a little flour, before I mixed them in.

I also made a sauce to fancy it up for Christmas dinner.
Used the lemon water I had the apples in so the wouldn't turn brown, a stick of butter, lemon, ginger and a little flour. Sorry I couldn't tell you the amounts, just kind of threw it in a pot and prayed and stirred! 

I enjoy reading how everyone makes this recipe their own!

My family loved this cake. We are German and Native American mixed family and apples are our favorite fruit ( we have 15 trees) I made it the first time exactly per the recipe from then on I doubled the apples because my Indian husband said it needed to be more apple-ly now the ask for it about once a week in the winter.

Made this twice now with 3/4 cup of coconut oil instead of butter, only 1 cup of sugar (1/2 white, 1/2 brown), mixed grated apples and a little ginger powder in addition to much more cinnamon and nutmeg. It's moist and delicious. Also add a confectioners sugar/milk glaze. Thanks for a great base recipe.

Made this twice now with 3/4 cup of coconut oil instead of butter, only 1 cup of sugar (1/2 white, 1/2 brown), mixed grated apples and a little ginger powder in addition to much more cinnamon and nutmeg. It's moist and delicious. Also add a confectioners sugar/milk glaze. Thanks for a great base recipe.

This is very moist, tasty and spicy. Easy to make and on a cold day with a cup of apple tea it hits the spot.
I may cut the nutmeg back to 1/2 tsp as one other person mentioned as the nutmeg seems strong. My wife liked it as is so may have to compromise.
Will make this again and soon!

I tried this and reduced the sugar to 1 cup and added 1/4 brown sugar. I think I could have added 1/2 cup brown sugar instead and it would still be fine. The texture is nice but it was a little dry. Definitely a coffee cake. Next time I might try substituting the butter with apple sauce . I also didn't use the raisins.
I made it without the raisins. Really good, moist cake. Cooked perfectly in a tube pan.
I added 5, not 3, apples, plus chopped pecans. Used light brown sugar and white sugar combo. Baked in a bundt pan. Moist and delicious!! Great spices.

Excellent recipe. I would have given 5 stars except that I made a couple of changes. I used 1/2 butter, 1/2 apple sauce to cut back on the oiliness; followed other users advice and substituted 1/2 cup of brown sugar and 1- 1/2 cup of white sugar. For spices I doubled the cinnamon, used only a sprinkle of nutmeg and 1 tsp of cloves. I also added some walnuts. This was a very moist cake that sets up beautifully over night. Could also be served directly out of the oven with some whipped cream because it is so soft. Definitely a keeper!
I used this recipe but made it gluten free. the apples were placed at the bottom of of the pan before the batter.
Took advice of others to cut down on calories. 1 cup sugar. 1/2 cup butter. 1/2 cup applesauce. Also changed spices to 2 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp cloves, 1/2 tsp nutmeg
A delicious recipe! I only decreased the sugar by a bit and it turned out perfect!!

This is a wonderful moist bundt cake. I diced three large organic Fuji apples along with 1/2 cup of white sugar and 1/2 cup of brown. I doubled all of the spices and used a mix of golden and Thompson raisins. These are the only changes I made.

When the batter was ready, it was fairly chunky but it baked up fine. It took 45 minutes to bake through.

The cake is plenty sweet enough, but even more of a treat with maple cream cheese frosting (which was kind of hard to spread on a bundt cake).

Next time, I would consider adding a little clove and maybe carrot or pineapple just to mix things up a bit.
Super great consistency and clear directions. Definitely too sweet! I think you can get away with less sugar for sure, and that's what I'd do for a future iteration.

Very moist and delicious! I tweaked it to make it GLUTEN-FREE for my crew. Instead of 2 cups of flour, I used 1 1/2 cups of brown rice flour, 1/3 cup of potato starch, 1/3 cup tapioca starch, and 1 tsp of xantham gum. I also added 1/2 tsp of baking powder. I was out of raisins, so I used dried cranberries. I used Gala apples, which were wonderful. The texture was light, not too dense or heavy as some GF cakes can be. It took about 10 mins longer to cook. I did put it in a bundt cake pan, and I was bummed it didn't turn out perfectly. It is not a pretty cake, but I can fix it with a little powdered sugar on top. Still, as far a gluten-free cakes go - it was delish!!

It tastes great, but I used a Bundt pan and couldn't get it out of the pan. It ended up breaking in half. I did spray the pan with PAM, but think maybe a different type of pan would work better. Also omitted the raisins since I didn't have any and I think it taste better without them.
I loved this cake, I cut the sugar in half and added apple sauce. Very good
This cake was so moist and yummy that my hubby ate it too. I didn't put raisins in the recipe since I don't like them. Thanks for sharing the recipe!
Loved it, made a few changes put apples and softened raisins in a nutribullet. Substituted sour cream for half of butter. Next time I'll add walnuts.

I've baked this cake a couple of times now and every time, none of it gets wasted which is great. I made a few changes to the recipe, omitting a cup of white sugar and replacing it with brown sugar which I think gave it a richer flavour. I also added at least 3x the amount of spices as I knew that just one teaspoon of each of the spices was not going to be enough. Despite adding a lot more spice, the cake had a mild flavour, but it was very pleasant. Next time I think I will add a fourth apple to the recipe as I love the texture of the apples after they are baked. All round, a pleasant cake, very moist and delicious. Will continue to bake it :)
Took to a family gathering today and it was a hit! Very good recipe!
Found this to be way too oily and not much flavour. More like a suet pudding, not what i expected at all. The texture was too soft and doughy. Will not make this again
This cake came out like a cracker
Very tasty and moist. I omitted the raisins and baked it in two round pans than frosted with cream cheese frosting and candied pecans. Super delicious and pretty!

Very good. Not oily at all. Nuts would be good. I almost shredded a carrot the second time, just to experiment. But seriously, it was excellent just as it was. Will reduce sugar a bit, maybe the butter as suggested, just to feel less guilty when I eat it all up!

This recipe makes a lovely moist bundt cake. I shredded my apples like a review suggested and it compliments the texture. The only reason I am not giving this recipe a full 5 stars is that I found the spices to be a bit underwhelming. This cake has a very mild flavor.
The flavors are terrific. I agree with previous reviewers that there is a bit too much butter. I would by a quarter or half. But the taste was yummy and everyone had seconds.

Buttering the pan gives it a nice crisp edge. Added tons of apples, used applesauce for half the butter, halved the sugar. All Whole wheat flour. laid down walnuts, br sugar, cinnamon and butter in the bundt pan first fora nutty topping. thanks for the recipe! Everybody lovvvvvvvvvvvves it!!

This smells so good coming out of the oven! I made a few little modifications, less sugar (1c.white, 1/2c. brown), I grated 2 of the apples and finely chopped the other. I also used a little less butter, mainly because it comes in 100 gram packs and I didn't want to open up 3 of them. (1c. equals about 225grams) Went a little crazy with the powered sugar. Made for my awesome knitting group!
I'm not much of a baker, but I'm learning. The only thing I changed were the raisins, since I don't like them. This cake was so wonderful.

So amazing!!!! I did double the spices because we like a real punch of flavor and I'm so glad I did! This cake stays moist, I'd actually say it's better the second day. I added a glaze, just using powdered sugar, water, and a few drops of orange oil. Poured it on the top and let it run down the sides. It was wonderful.

This cake is wonderful. I made it in a angel food cake pan and the only changes I made was that I used 1/2 cup of light brown sugar and 1 & 1/2 cup white sugar. I also made a cream cheese frosting and added around a TB of maple syrup to it. I also took another person's suggestion and used my food processor to shred the apples. It doesn't really shred but it cuts them up really fine, then I put them in a colander and kind of used my hands to squeeze out a lot of the excess juice. This tip really saves a lot of time and mess. This cake is really moist and delicious. I will certainly make it again and I highly recommend this recipe.
The cake was so good my Chocolate Lab helped herself to a entire cake. Luckily, I made more than one. *** I DID NOT use raisins, ADDED CLOVE and DID NOT cook it a hour. HUGE HIT IN MY WORLD!!!

Isn't funny how some people say "too spicy" and some say "not spicy enough"? I'm in the not spicy enough camp. I doubled the cinnamon but was afraid to do too much different on a first try. This was an extremely yummy cake, very moist. I added toasted walnuts because I think everything's better with nuts! (don't understand the "greasy" comment by one reviewer.) I used canned cream cheese icing. Next time I will double all the spices and perhaps make a caramel icing from scratch. Thanks for a really nice recipe!

This is a simple, quick and easy to make. The outside crust is great. I used coconut oil instead of butter and only about 3/4 cup, I do this only because I try to use less butter in everything. I also added chopped pecans, again because I use nuts whenever possible. I will make this again. Thanks for a great recipe!
Excellent?? did use 1 c of sugar and 1 c of brwn sgr. Also used cranraisins. Did as a bundt cake. Moist and yummy!

Excellent! I chopped the apples small and used another reviewer's suggestion of substituting half of the butter with applesauce. I made mini bundt cakes (baked for 15 minutes) instead of one large one. Will definitely make again :-)

I made this recipe this past weekend and loved it!! Much easier to make than I suspected it would be, and very, very tasty! I expected it to be a bit dry, but it was very moist and has maintained well in the fridge since I made it. The powdered sugar on top does add something to the overall flavor, but could be left off if you wanted to lower the sugar content. I suspected that the powdered sugar would get "gummy" after some time in the fridge, so I choose to sprinkle each individual serving as I go. Thanks for a great recipe!!

I don't know, maybe I overcooked it (only had it in for 50 minutes), but I though it was kind of dry. Maybe cause I used tub non dairy margarine instead of real butter, a little harder to measure. Maybe I will try some frosting on it.

This recipe was outstanding! Truly a delightful find. I had apples that needed to be used, and this was the answer. Our family is gluten-free, so I used gluten-free all-purpose flour and added 1 tsp. xanthan gum. Used 4 apples shredded in the food processor. Perfect in every way! Thank you for a fantastic recipe!
Its very tasty recipe. Everyone love it

So it taste amazing but for my personal taste i would add less nutmeg and this time i added dried cherries raisins apple slices raspberry blackberry and strawberry and I only had 3/4 cup of butter and no vegetable oil and i added about 3 tablespoons of olive oil and instead of mixing it i blended it. Last change was i did it in a square pan. it taste amazing . I love this recipe.

I don't make cakes very often but wanted to gift a neighbour who is ill. This cake is moist and flavourful and makes a great gift. It lifted my neighbour's spirits just with the aroma of it when I walked in with it straight from the oven. This recipe is a definite keeper!

This cake is awesome! I made it for my moms birthday for a change( we are a chocolate family!) and everyone loved it. My father was skeptical, but he really liked it and came back for more. I omitted the raisins since my fam doesn't like them. Thank you so much for a great recipe!:)
Used Brown and white sugar and grated apples. Also added a few tablespoons boiled cider from king Arthur site. Very nice.
If you like fall apple cake this is exactly what you are looking for.

Delicious. I took the advice of some other reviewers and used double the allspice and tripled the cinnamon. My husband and I love cinnamon. We also only used 1/2 c white sugar and 1/2 c brown sugar. I only had almond milk, which worked perfectly. My house smelled amazing while baking and the cake was fantastic. I coupled it with my coffee in the morning. :)
